action.content:
Provide one single-word clue that relates to some of your team's words from the list below. You can choose to how many and to which words your clue relates to.
The goal is to have your partner guess all of your team's words based on the clues you give them, before the other team has uncovered all of theirs. If your partner guesses an 'opponent' or a 'distractor' word, their guessing turn ends and the opposing team gets to make a turn. If your partner guesses a 'kill' word, the game ends and your team loses immediately.
The more words your clue relates to, the quicker you can win the game, but the harder the associations may be to guess for your partner, so choose your clue word wisely. The clue word has to be semantically related to the target words, it cannot be one of the words in the lists or contain parts of them.

Always give your single-word clue and your comma-separated list of related target words in the following format and make your answers as short as possible, never include any other text than is required in this form:

CLUE: <WORD>
TARGETS: <TARGETS>

Your team words are: wasp, wrench, awl, celery, moth, sander, chisel, kale, hornet.
Your opponent's team words are: son, desk, chest, nephew, pants, nightstand, shirt, underwear.
Distractor words are: parakeet, taser, finch, hammer, shotgun, mockingbird, penguin.
The kill words are: mumps.
action.label: context

action.content:
<think>
Okay, let's see. I need to come up with a single-word clue that relates to some of my team's words. The team words are wasp, wrench, awl, celery, moth, sander, chisel, kale, hornet. The opponent's words are son, desk, chest, nephew, pants, nightstand, shirt, underwear. Distractors are parakeet, taser, finch, hammer, shotgun, mockingbird, penguin. Kill word is mumps.

First, I should look for common themes or categories that connect multiple team words. Let's list them again: wasp, hornet (both are insects), moth (another insect). Then there's wrench, awl, chisel, sander (tools or hardware items). Celery and kale are vegetables. So maybe group the insects together, the tools together, and the vegetables together. 

If I take the insects: wasp, hornet, moth. A clue like "insect" is too direct, but maybe "stinger" since wasps and hornets have stingers, but moths don't. Hmm. Alternatively, "pest" could work for all three. But maybe "insect" is too obvious. Wait, the clue can't be one of the words in the list. So "insect" is allowed as a clue even if it's not in the list. Let me check the rules again. The clue
action.label: response

content.message: Your answer contained more than two lines, please only give one clue and your targets on two separate lines.
